parts.prose: Set the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Microsoft Outlook 2016 -> Meeting Workspace "Disable user entries to server list" to "Enabled (Publish default, disallow others)".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose: This policy setting controls whether Outlook users can add entries to the list of SharePoint servers when establishing a meeting workspace. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose between two options to determine whether Outlook users can add entries to the published server list: - Publish default, allow others. This option is the default configuration in Outlook. - Publish default, disallow others. This option prevents users from adding servers to the default published server list. If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, when users create a meeting workspace, they can choose a server from a default list provided by administrators or manually enter the address of a server that is not listed. This is the equivalent of Enabled -- Publish default, allow others.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: Automatically downloading enclosures on RSS must be disallowed.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Configure the system to provide only organization-defined mission essential capabilities.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Automatically downloading enclosures on RSS must be disallowed.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Set the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Microsoft Outlook 2016 -> Account Settings -> RSS Feeds "Automatically download enclosures" to "Disabled".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose: This policy setting allows you to control whether Outlook automatically downloads enclosures on RSS items. If you enable this policy setting, Outlook will automatically download enclosures on RSS items. If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, enclosures on RSS items are not downloaded by default.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: Outlook must be configured not to prompt users to choose security settings if default settings fail.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Implement the security configuration settings.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Outlook must be configured not to prompt users to choose security settings if default settings fail.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Set the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Microsoft Outlook 2016 -> Security "Prompt user to choose security settings if default settings fail" to "Disabled".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose: Check to prompt the user to choose security settings if default settings fail; uncheck to automatically select.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: Outlook minimum encryption key length settings must be set.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Implement organization-defined types of cryptography for each specified cryptography use.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Outlook minimum encryption key length settings must be set.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Set the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Microsoft Outlook 2016 -> Security -> Cryptography "Minimum encryption settings" to "Enabled: 168 bits".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose: This policy setting allows you to set the minimum key length for an encrypted e-mail message. If you enable this policy setting, you may set the minimum key length for an encrypted e-mail message.  Outlook will display a warning dialog if the user tries to send a message using an encryption key that is below the minimum encryption key value set. The user can still choose to ignore the warning and send using the encryption key originally chosen. If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, a dialog warning will be shown to the user if the user attempts to send a message using encryption.  The user can still choose to ignore the warning and send using the encryption key originally chosen.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: Replies or forwards to signed/encrypted messages must be signed/encrypted.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Implement the security configuration settings.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Replies or forwards to signed/encrypted messages must be signed/encrypted.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Set the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Microsoft Outlook 2016 -> Security -> Cryptography "Replies or forwards to signed/encrypted messages are signed/encrypted" to "Enabled".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose: This policy setting controls whether replies and forwards to signed/encrypted mail should also be signed/encrypted. If you enable this policy setting, signing/encryption will be turned on when replying/forwarding a signed or encrypted message, even if the user is not configured for SMIME. If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, signing/encryption is not enforced.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: Check e-mail addresses against addresses of certificates being used must be disallowed.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Implement the security configuration settings.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Check e-mail addresses against addresses of certificates being used must be disallowed.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Set the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Microsoft Outlook 2016 -> Security -> Cryptography "Do not check e-mail address against address of certificates being used" to "Enabled".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose: This policy setting controls whether Outlook verifies the user's e-mail address with the address associated with the certificate used for signing. If you enable this policy setting, users can send messages signed with certificates that do not match their e-mail addresses. If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, Outlook verifies that the user's e-mail address matches the certificate being used for signing.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: Read EMail as plain text must be enforced.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Implement the security configuration settings.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Read EMail as plain text must be enforced.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Set the policy value for User Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Microsoft Outlook 2016 >> Outlook Options >> Preferences >> E-mail Options "Read e-mail as plain text" to "Enabled".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose: Outlook can display email messages and other items in three formats: plain text, Rich Text Format (RTF), and HTML. By default, Outlook displays email messages in whatever format they were received.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: Read signed email as plain text must be enforced.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Implement the security configuration settings.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Read signed email as plain text must be enforced.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Set the policy value for User Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Microsoft Outlook 2016 >> Outlook Options >> Preferences >> E-mail Options "Read signed e-mail as plain text" to "Enabled".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose: Outlook can display email messages and other items in three formats: plain text, Rich Text Format (RTF), and HTML. By default, Outlook displays digitally signed email messages in the format which they were received.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: The default message format must be set to use Plain Text.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Implement the security configuration settings.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The default message format must be set to use Plain Text.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Set the policy value for User Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Microsoft Outlook 2016 >> Outlook Options >> Mail Format >> Internet Formatting >> Message Format "Set message format" to "Enabled: Plain Text".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose: Outlook uses HTML as the default email format. HTML format poses a security risk by embedding information into the email itself, which could allow for release of sensitive information. If a user attempted to insert an HTML link into an email message, the link itself may direct to a malicious website. By sending emails in HTML format, the recipient could be subject to becoming infected by the malicious website.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: Outlook Rich Text options must be set for converting to plain text format.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Implement the security configuration settings.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Outlook Rich Text options must be set for converting to plain text format.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Set the policy value for User Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Microsoft Outlook 2016 >> Outlook Options >> Mail Format >> Internet Formatting "Outlook Rich Text options" to "Enabled: Convert to Plain Text format".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose:
Outlook automatically converts Rich Text Format (RTF) messages that are sent over the internet to HTML format, so that the message formatting is maintained and attachments are received.
This setting controls how Outlook sends RTF messages to internet recipients.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: Text in Outlook that represents internet and network paths must not be automatically turned into hyperlinks.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Implement the security configuration settings.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Text in Outlook that represents internet and network paths must not be automatically turned into hyperlinks.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Set the policy User Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Microsoft Outlook 2016 >> Outlook Options >> "Internet and network path into hyperlinks" must be set to "Disabled".

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose: The ability of Outlook to automatically turn text that represents internet and network paths into hyperlinks would allow users to click on those hyperlinks in an email message and access malicious or otherwise harmful websites.

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.
